pr_title: Add support for private log subscriptions (Pub-Sub API)

timeline.bodyText: Should we also have a branch for an invalid params json rpc error?
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, I thought it was being done in the same way we do for the JsonRpc API (https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/master/ethereum/api/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/api/jsonrpc/JsonRpcHttpService.java#L590-L592).
Instead of adding it to each WebSocket method, I think we should add this to the WebSocketRequestHandler#handle. So it applies for any WebSocket request.
replies.author: lucassaldanha

replies.bodyText:
Done! 👍
WebSocketRequestHandler now will handle a InvalidJsonRpcParameters exception.
replies.author: lucassaldanha

timeline.bodyText: I understand that we might not be able to reach the nirvana of not checking anything on disk for each block added event like we can with the mainnet side but could we at least take advantage of the fact that we already have the logs from the block added event and get the bare minimum from the privacy storage to filter a subset of them?
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: I don't think I understand your suggestion. The logs in the block added event are only logs generated by public contracts. We can't really use them to find private logs.
replies.author: lucassaldanha

I think the way that it is implemented makes it more readable. PrivacyQueries start empty and, if privacy is enabled, we set it to the proper object.
I think in this case the ternary operator will make it less readable.

timeline.bodyText:
We do this in the PrivacyApiGroupJsonRpcMethods as well, but in the PrivJsonRpcMethods we do pass the privacy controller and the enclavePublicKeyProvider into the create() method.
This means that we have several instances of the controller and enclavePKP where we would only need one.
Can we fix that in a nice way?
